    • Constructor Detail

      • ReadXCompany

        public ReadXCompany(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String nit)
        New Company: Constructs a new ReadX company with the specified name and NIT.
        Preconditions:
        None.
        Postconditions:
        A new ReadX company is created with an empty list of bibliographic products and users.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the ReadX company.
        nit - The NIT (tax identification number) of the ReadX company.

    • Method Detail

      • registerBibliographic

        public java.lang.String registerBibliographic(java.lang.String indentifier,
                                              java.lang.String name,
                                              int pagesNumber,
                                              java.util.Calendar publicationDate,
                                              java.lang.String url,
                                              java.lang.String review,
                                              int gender,
                                              double value,
                                              int typeBibliographic)
        Regist a book: Registers a new bibliographic product with the specified parameters.
        Preconditions:
        None.
        Postconditions:
        If the specified identifier does not already exist, a new Book object is created and added to the ReadX company's list of bibliographic products.
        Parameters:
        indentifier - The identifier for the new bibliographic product.
        name - The name of the new bibliographic product.
        pagesNumber - The number of pages in the new bibliographic product.
        publicationDate - The publication date of the new bibliographic product.
        url - The URL for the new bibliographic product.
        review - The review for the new bibliographic product.
        gender - The gender for the new bibliographic product.
        value - The value for the new bibliographic product.
        typeBibliographic - The type of bibliographic product (book, magazine, or newspaper).
        Returns:
        A message indicating whether the new bibliographic product was registered successfully or if the specified identifier already exists.

      • registerBibliographic

        public java.lang.String registerBibliographic(java.lang.String indentifier,
                                              java.lang.String name,
                                              int pagesNumber,
                                              java.util.Calendar publicationDate,
                                              java.lang.String url,
                                              int category,
                                              double suscriptionValue,
                                              int publicationFrequency,
                                              int typeBibliographic)
        Regist a magazine: Registers a new bibliographic product with the specified parameters.
        Postconditions:
        If the specified identifier does not already exist, a new Magazine object is created and added to the ReadX company's list of bibliographic products.
        Parameters:
        indentifier - The identifier for the new bibliographic product.
        name - The name of the new bibliographic product.
        pagesNumber - The number of pages in the new bibliographic product.
        publicationDate - The publication date of the new bibliographic product.
        url - The URL for the new bibliographic product.
        category - The category of the new bibliographic product.
        suscriptionValue - The subscription value for the new bibliographic product.
        publicationFrequency - The publication frequency for the new bibliographic product.
        typeBibliographic - The type of bibliographic product (book, magazine, or newspaper).
        Returns:
        A message indicating whether the new bibliographic product was registered successfully or if the specified identifier already exists.

      • imprimBibliographicName

        public java.lang.String imprimBibliographicName(java.lang.String indentifier)
        Print a product's name: Returns the name of a bibliographic product with the given identifier.
        Preconditions:
        A bibliographic product with the given identifier must exist in the catalog.
        Postconditions:
        The name of the bibliographic product is returned as a String.
        Parameters:
        indentifier - The identifier of the bibliographic product to search for.
        Returns:
        The name of the bibliographic product as a String.

      • imprimUserName

        public java.lang.String imprimUserName(java.lang.String idUser)
        Print user's name: Returns a greeting message for the user with the given identifier, including their name and a message about their appearance if they are a regular user.
        Preconditions:
        A user with the given identifier must exist in the system.
        Postconditions:
        A greeting message is returned as a String.
        Parameters:
        idUser - The identifier of the user to greet.
        Returns:
        A greeting message for the user as a String.

      • acquireProducts

        public java.lang.String acquireProducts(java.lang.String idUser,
                                        java.lang.String indentifier)
        Acquire products: Acquires a bibliographic product for the user with the given identifier, updating their library, generating a billing, and possibly updating their regular user status.
        Preconditions:
        A user with the given identifier and a bibliographic product with the given identifier must exist in the system.
        Postconditions:
        The bibliographic product is acquired by the user and added to their library, a billing is generated, and the regular user status is updated if applicable. A message describing the result of the operation is returned as a String.
        Parameters:
        idUser - The identifier of the user acquiring the product.
        indentifier - The identifier of the bibliographic product to acquire.
        Returns:
        A message describing the result of the operation as a String.

      • userVerification

        public boolean userVerification(User user)
        User's verification: Verifies if the user has reached the limit of books and magazines they can acquire, depending on their regular user status.
        Preconditions:
        The user must exist in the system.
        Postconditions:
        None.
        Parameters:
        user - The user to verify.
        Returns:
        True if the user has not reached their acquisition limits, false otherwise.

      • updateRegularUser

        public void updateRegularUser(int op,
                              User user)
        Update regular user's verification: Updates the regular user's statistics based on the provided operation.
        Preconditions:
        The user must be a regular user.
        Postconditions:
        The regular user's statistics are updated based on the provided operation.
        Parameters:
        op - The operation to perform: 1 for updating the books count, 2 for updating the magazines subscribed count.
        user - The regular user to update.

      • finishSuscription

        public java.lang.String finishSuscription(java.lang.String idUser,
                                          java.lang.String indentifier)
        Finish a user's suscription: Finishes the suscription to a magazine for the specified user.
        Preconditions:
        The user must exist and have an active suscription to the magazine.
        Postconditions:
        The user's suscription to the magazine is finished and removed from their library.
        Parameters:
        idUser - The ID of the user who wants to finish the suscription.
        indentifier - The identifier of the magazine to finish the suscription to.
        Returns:
        A message indicating whether the suscription was successfully finished or not.

      • productsLibrary

        public java.lang.String productsLibrary(java.lang.String idUser,
                                        int libraryPag)
        User's library: Retrieves the list of products in the library of the specified user.
        Preconditions:
        The user must exist in the system.
        Postconditions:
        The list of products in the user's library is returned as a formatted string.
        Parameters:
        idUser - The ID of the user whose library to retrieve.
        libraryPag - A library page
        Returns:
        A formatted string containing the list of products in the user's library.

      • generateBiliographicProduct

        public java.lang.String generateBiliographicProduct(int opbi)
        Generate bibliographic product automatically: Generates a bibliographic product based on the specified operation type.
        Parameters:
        opbi - The operation type for generating the bibliographic product. If opbi is 1, a random book is generated. If opbi is any other value, a random magazine is generated.
        Returns:
        A string containing information about the generated bibliographic product.

      • generateUser

        public java.lang.String generateUser(int opuse)
        Generate users automatically: Generates a new user.
        Preconditions:
        None.
        Postconditions:
        A new user is generated and added to the user list.
        Parameters:
        opuse - An integer representing the type of user to generate. If opuse is 1, a regular user is generated, otherwise a premium user is generated.
        Returns:
        A string containing information about the generated user.

        Returns:

      • searchAcquireProduct

        public boolean searchAcquireProduct(java.lang.String indentifier,
                                    java.lang.String idUser)
        Search a user's acquire product: Searches for a bibliographic product by identifier and attempts to acquire it for a user.
        Preconditions:
        The identifier and user ID must be non-null and non-empty.
        Postconditions:
        If the product is found and acquired by the user, returns true. Otherwise, returns false.
        Parameters:
        indentifier - A String representing the identifier of the bibliographic product to search for.
        idUser - A String representing the ID of the user attempting to acquire the product.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether or not the product was successfully acquired by the user.

      • searchAcquireProduct

        public BibliographicProduct searchAcquireProduct(java.lang.String op,
                                                 int row,
                                                 int columns,
                                                 java.lang.String idUser,
                                                 int libraryPag)
        Reading simulations: Simulates a user reading a bibliographic product.
        Preconditions:
        The user ID and product identifier must be non-null and non-empty.
        Postconditions:
        If the user and product are found, simulates the user reading the product and returns an alert message. Otherwise, returns an error message indicating the user or product was not found.
        Parameters:
        op - A identifier's product or a matriz position
        idUser - A String representing the ID of the user simulating the reading.
        identifier - A String representing the identifier of the bibliographic product being read.
        row - The row number of the product in the library.
        columns - The column number of the product in the library.
        Returns:
        A String representing an alert message indicating the success or failure of the simulation.

      • countSimulateReading

        public java.lang.String countSimulateReading(java.lang.String op,
                                             int row,
                                             int columns,
                                             java.lang.String idUser,
                                             int pag,
                                             int libraryPag)
        Number of pages watched: Counts the number of pages a user has simulated reading in a bibliographic product.
        Preconditions:
        The user ID and product identifier must be non-null and non-empty. The page number must be greater than 0.
        Postconditions:
        If the user and product are found, counts the number of pages simulated and returns an alert message indicating the success of the operation. Otherwise, returns an error message indicating the user or product was not found.
        Parameters:
        idUser - A String representing the ID of the user whose reading is being counted.
        row - The row number of the product in the library.
        columns - The column number of the product in the library.
        identifier - A String representing the identifier of the bibliographic product being read.
        pag - An integer representing the number of pages to count.
        Returns:
        A String representing an alert message indicating the success or failure of the operation.

      • count

        public int count(int option,
                 int pag,
                 java.lang.String op,
                 int row,
                 int columns,
                 java.lang.String idUser,
                 int libraryPag)
        Pages count update: Adjusts the current page of a bibliographic product based on a given operation and page number.
        Preconditions:
        The operation must be either 1 (decrement) or 2 (increment). The page number must be greater than 0. The product identifier must be non-null and non-empty.
        Postconditions:
        If the product is found, adjusts the current page and updates the product's reading statistics if necessary. Returns the adjusted page number.
        Parameters:
        option - An integer representing the operation to perform on the current page. 1 indicates decrement, 2 indicates increment.
        pag - An integer representing the current page number.
        op - A String representing the identifier of the bibliographic product being read.
        row - An integer representing the row of the product.
        columns - An integer representing the column of the product.
        idUser - A string representing the ID of the user.
        libraryPag - An integer representing the library page of the user.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the adjusted page number.

      • simulateReading

        public java.lang.String simulateReading(java.lang.String op,
                                        int row,
                                        int columns,
                                        java.lang.String idUser,
                                        int libraryPag)
        Simulate Reading: Simulates the reading process for a user.
        Preconditions:
        The product must be acquired by the user.
        Postconditions:
        The reading process is simulated based on the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        op - A string representing the type of product being read.
        row - An integer representing the row of the product.
        columns - An integer representing the column of the product.
        idUser - A string representing the ID of the user.
        libraryPag - An integer representing the library page of the user.
        Returns:
        A string representing the alert message for the simulated reading process.

      • generateReports

        public java.lang.String generateReports()
        Generate Reports: Generates various reports.
        Preconditions:
        None.
        Postconditions:
        Reports are generated and returned as a string.
        Returns:
        A string containing the generated reports.

        public java.lang.String mostReadType()

        Preconditions:

        Postconditions:
        The most read category of magazines and genre of books are determined and returned as a string.
        Returns:
        A string representing the most read category of magazines and genre of books.

        A string containing the top books and magazines based on reading pages.
